-}Z@iE:o&IEx~=W.sgRj@}"AAel2'bE8&t?qEc;N
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
Tall yellowed grass surrounds you, dotted by sweetly scented, strange wild
flowers. The warm, alien plains stretch on as far as the eye can see, and the
planet's sun is beginning to set on the horizon. Two moons loom in the lavender
sky. Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through
the windows, you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and

direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
Endless waves ripple off into the distance beyond this wooden ship's railings.
Thick timbers rest underfoot, creaking steadily as the craft bobs up and down.
Large white sails billow overhead, propelling the ship across the sea's surface
at a steady pace. Puffy white clouds float through the sky placidly while a
bright yellow star beats down with merciless heat. Salt spray fills the air
intermittently when the ship crashes through a wave, and the rope rigging creaks
loudly with each gust. A few gulls circle lazily overhead, although no land is
in sight. Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking
through the windows, you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, a blue plastic food storage container, Desiree the little
black and white spotted CatBot, Kiska the humanoid service robot, a red plastic
food storage container, and Xavier the big silver soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

read last league
--
Shule. Here is the report I promised you. I hope at the very least it makes it
so that the League doesn't catch you by surprise.
First, the meeting point. IF you are able, meet at the torus, with a secondary
meeting point at Earth if the Torus is inaccessible. Crew large ships first,
then small ships if we are able. Let the larger ships take care of larger
targets, and smaller ships take care of smaller targets. I know it's possible to
beat a larger ship with a smaller, but it's more efficient this way.
The largest ship in the sector has command of the fleet and if they tell a
smaller ship to do something, the smaller ship should listen.
IF two or more ships are engaging the same target, don't go to where the enemy
has just been, or you will open yourself to friendly fire. I know it's not
always possible, but try to stay on different z-axis coordinates than your
allies, that will avoid unnecessary blockages and could cause ships to get hit.
I would like to see this done with all the alliances and have designated z-axis
points for each, but I seriously doubt I can get everyone to go along with that.
If the enemy is an ifs fleet, please refer to the posts about ifs priority on
this board. If you are fighting ifs, it is best to have two or more larger ships
to take turns taking the lrl damage.
I would love to have invasion drills, but my previous attempts to implement them
have been unsuccessful, however, the better prepared we are, the harder it will
be for us to be subjugated again.
--

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, a blue plastic food storage container, Desiree the little
black and white spotted CatBot, Kiska the humanoid service robot, a white foam
box, a small red insulated cooler, and Xavier the big silver soldier felo here.
You can go south and out.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a cerulean blue synthcotton shipsuit and a pair of white leather
boots decorated with neon purple stars. She is also wearing an orange and white
blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling
silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid
silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small
purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple
reinforced plastic phone holster, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly
labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes, both wrists, and both hands are
left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.
Jewel the large violet glowing felo wanders in from the south.

help titles
--
Star Conquest Help: Pilot Titles
--
Category: Game Systems
--
Pilots can hold a number of titles which may appear in the WHO command, or
simply be referred to in character by others.
Cadet: Cadets are, basically, newbies. ICly, these are pilots who have just been
granted a license and are flying provisionally pending final approval from their
flight school. If the pilot conducts her- or himself well during this
probationary period, they are granted a full license -- something other pilots
refer to as "graduating." OOCly, a cadet is a player who has not yet submitted
an acceptable character profile.
Pilot: This title is also available, and is meant to be understood as "full
pilot." The vast majority of playable characters are regular pilots, so this
title does not say anything much about a character.
Ace: Aces are pilots who have been recognized for exceptional combat prowess and
leadership. This title is typically awarded only after periods of serious
fighting during which a handful of pilots distinguish themselves in combat. This
is mostly just a title, but ace pilots receive a bit of special consideration,
such as free starship support.
Veteran: Veterans are similar to ace pilots, but are long-term characters who
have fought in several serious conflicts. New characters will generally never be
approved for veteran status.
Other titles may be granted for performing an unusual action or participating in
an event, such as "Drydock Defender." The IC/OOC barrier is a bit flimsy here,
but you may regard these titles as appearing on your communicator display or
simply being something that person is known for -- whichever makes more sense.
You can change your own active title with the TITLE command.
--
A short violet soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles rears up
suddenly from behind a plastic shipwreck flying a pirate flag and wraps its
tentacles around it as if trying to drag it into the deep.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
Crystal clear water fills the fishbowl, and layer of gravel on the floor creates
a natural looking substrate. A bubbling plastic treasure chest in the center is
guarded by a plastic diver wearing a diving bell, and a kelp-like neon green
plastic plant waves around, anchored into the gravel. A large goldfish and
several tetras inhabit the fishbowl, along with a snail. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, a blue plastic food storage container, Desiree the little

in intensity, and flow from Galactic Southsouthwest and Down.

l second jewel
Jewel the sleeping large violet glowing felo [inside a rare black EAOSian
contoured couch with a hand-made white and sapphire star quilt and Jewel the
sleeping large violet glowing felo on it]
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, speckled violet fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, average legs each end in three-toed paws with thin, hooked white claws
visible. A white, square nose sits below a pair of clear blue eyes with
cassiopeian pupils. It puts out a subtle violet bioluminescence tinged with
light green. It is wearing a sparkling emerald collar. It also has a pair of
dark violet satin tail ribbons tied in bows. It appears to be sleeping.
